intro: Pandanus oligocarpus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pandanus, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and long, narrow leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit, known as a "breadfruit," is edible and has a starchy texture similar to bread. Pandanus oligocarpus thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in mangrove areas.
